Key Match Events: Daryl Mitchell hammered a 26-ball his fastest fifty for New Zealand in T20 international
Daryl Mitchell and Devon Conway set up the third highest third-wicket partnership for New Zealand against India in T20 internationals
Washington Sundar hammered a 25-ball third fastest fifty by an Indian batsman against New Zealand in T20Is
New Zealand's 176 was their seventh highest score against India in T20 international and It is their third highest total in Indian soil in T20is
Arshdeep Singh went for 27 runs in the final over of the innings, the third-most expensive over by a Indian bowler in T20 internationals
Arshdeep Singh conceded 51 runs - which was his second most runs conceded for India in One-day international and the joint fourth most runs-conceded by a Indian bowler against New Zealand in T20Is
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell named Player of the match for his blazing unbeaten 59-runs knocked off facing 30-balls including 5-sixes and 3-fours with strike rate of 196.66
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand scored 176-6 in 20 overs with top scorer by Daryl Mitchell hammered a unbeaten 59 off 30-balls

Devon Conway blasted a 52 off 35-balls including 7-fours & a six with strike rate of 148.57, Finn Allen hammered a 35 off 23-balls included 4-fours & 2-sixes with strike rate of 152.17 and Glenn Phillips 17
India best bowler by Washington Sundar takes 2-wickets, Shivam Mavi, Kuldeep Yadav and Arshdeep Singh each took one-wickets
India scored 155-9 in 20 overs with top scorer by Washington Sundar hammered a career-best 50 off 28-balls including 5-fours & 3-sixes with strike rate of 178.57
Suryakumar Yadav struck 47 off 34-balls including 6-fours & 2-sixes and Hardik Pandya scored 21 off 20-balls included one-six & a four
New Zealand best bowler by Mitchell Santner, Michael Bracewell, Lockie Ferguson each took 2-wickets and one for Jacob Duffy - Ish Sodhi
Others: Blazing half-centuries from Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell before Spinners Michael Bracewell, Mitchell Santner and Ish Sodhi helped to New Zealand comprehensive 21-run victory over India, despite a fighting knock from Washington Sundar's 25-ball maiden fifty
